On this page

Network Configuration â€‹

Configure and manage network connections in Debian 13 using NetworkManager and command-line tools.

ğŸŒ NetworkManager â€‹

Basic Configuration â€‹

bash
# Check network status
nmcli device status

# Show connections
nmcli connection show

# Connect to WiFi
nmcli dev wifi connect "NetworkName" password "password"

# Restart NetworkManager
sudo systemctl restart NetworkManager

Static IP Configuration â€‹

bash
# Create static connection
nmcli con add type ethernet con-name "static" ifname eth0 \
  ip4 192.168.1.100/24 gw4 192.168.1.1

# Set DNS servers
nmcli con mod "static" ipv4.dns "8.8.8.8,8.8.4.4"

# Activate connection
nmcli con up "static"

ğŸ“¡ WiFi Management â€‹

Command Line WiFi â€‹

bash
# List available networks
nmcli dev wifi list

# Connect to network
nmcli dev wifi connect "SSID" password "password"

# Show saved connections
nmcli con show

# Delete connection
nmcli con delete "connection-name"

ğŸ”§ Manual Configuration â€‹

Using /etc/network/interfaces â€‹

bash
# Edit network configuration
sudo nano /etc/network/interfaces

# Example static configuration:
auto eth0
iface eth0 inet static
  address 192.168.1.100
  netmask 255.255.255.0
  gateway 192.168.1.1
  dns-nameservers 8.8.8.8 8.8.4.4
